intro: Cheirinia brachycarpa, commonly known as the short-fruited cheirinia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers. Native to southern Africa, this plant thrives in dry, rocky habitats. The fruit is small and spherical, with a distinctive ribbed structure. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
